metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3171 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
sosreport 3.2 uses weak permissions for generated sosreport archives, whichallows local users with access to /var/tmp/ to obtain sensitive informationby reading the contents of the archive.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3171` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

sosreport - 3.1-1ubuntu2.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: sosreport package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1-1ubuntu2.1').
